text: Amproxin: Safety Protocols & Dosage Guidelines. Internal Document. 1. Safety Profile. Adverse Reactions (Reported in < 5% of Patients): Nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, photosensitivity. 2. Standard Dosage Regimen. Dosage depends on infection type. Table 2: Recommended Dosage by Indication.

sections.heading: 1. Safety Profile
sections.content: Representatives must address physician concerns regarding resistance and side effects like GI distress and photosensitivity.

sections.heading: 2. Standard Dosage Regimen
sections.content: Dosage varies by indication severity and location.

text: 3. Contraindications & Warnings. Hypersensitivity to fluoroquinolones. Tendon Health concerns for elderly. Pediatric use restrictions. 4. Handling Objections: Safety. Addressing black box warnings with molecular structure refinements.

sections.heading: 3. Contraindications & Warnings
sections.content: Includes hypersensitivity alerts and specific warnings for tendon health and pediatric populations.

sections.heading: 4. Handling Objections: Safety
sections.content: Strategic response focusing on refined molecular structure minimizing CNS binding and neurological side effects.
